ctx: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3.
assert (H4: plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s).
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 6 branches.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : Term A n) (p q s : list (Term A n)), eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) a b -> ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b) -> plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s -> s = pX (A:=A) (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b) (pluspf p q)

Premises:
pX : forall (A : Set) (n : nat), Term A n -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n)
pluspf = fun l1 l2 : list (Term A n) => projsig1 (list (Term A n)) (fun a : list (Term A n) => plusP (fst (l1, l2)) (snd (l1, l2)) a) (plusp (l1, l2)) : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) Arguments pluspf (_ _)%list_scope
CoefStructure : forall (A : Set) (A0 : A), A -> forall eqA : A -> A -> Prop, (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A) -> Prop
eqT : forall (A : Set) (n : nat), Term A n -> Term A n -> Prop
OrderStructure : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> (A -> A -> A) -> Prop
zeroP : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Prop
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
Inductive plusP : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop := nillu1 : forall l1 : list (Term A n), plusP (pO A n) l1 l1 | nillu2 : forall l1 : list (Term A n), plusP l1 (pO A n) l1 | mainu1 : forall (a1 a2 : Term A n) (l1 l2 l3 : list (Term A n)), ltT (A:=A) ltM a2 a1 -> plusP l1 (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a2 l2)
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d

plusTerm_comp_r : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA -> forall (n : nat) (a b c : Term A n), eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) c a -> eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) c b -> eqTerm eqA (n:=n) a b -> eqTerm eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) c a) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) c b)

original: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3. assert (H4: plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s). { apply H3. } destruct H4 as [l1 [H5 [H6 H7]]]. destruct H7 as [H8 | [H9 | H10]]. - rewrite H8 in H5. assert (H11: ltT (A:=A) ltM b a). { apply H5. } assert (H12: plusP p (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) l1). { apply H6. } assert (H13: s = pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a l1). { apply H8. } assert (H14: s = pluspf p (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q)). { eapply plusP_inv2; eauto. } rewrite H14. apply pluspf_eq. - rewrite H9 in H5. assert (H11: ltT (A:=A) ltM a b). { apply H5. } assert (H12: plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q l1). { apply H6. } assert (H13: s = pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b l1). { apply H9. } assert (H14: s = pluspf (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q). { eapply plusP_inv1; eauto. } rewrite H14. apply pluspf_eq. - rewrite H10 in H5. assert (H11: eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) a b). { apply H5. } assert (H12: zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) a \/ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b). { eapply plusP_inv3a; eauto. } destruct H12 as [H13 | H13]. + assert (H14: eqTerm eqA (n:=n) b (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b)). { eapply zeroP_plusTerml; eauto. } rewrite H14. apply plusTerm_comp_l; eauto. + assert (H14: eqTerm eqA (n:=n) a (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b)). { eapply zeroP_plusTermr; eauto. } rewrite H14. apply plusTerm_comp_r; eauto.
